episodeTitle: Oars Plus Moria - The Greatest Combination of Brains and Brawn
description: Luffy pursues Moria's shadow through Thriller Bark while the crew battles Oars. Kuma arrives to inform Moria that Blackbeard has replaced Crocodile as a Warlord. As the ship drifts out of the Florian Triangle's protective fog, Moria enters a cockpit inside Oars' stomach, combining his strategic mind with the giant's overwhelming power.

events.title: Luffy Pursues Moria's Shadow
events.description: Luffy chases after what he believes is Gecko Moria, only to discover he's been pursuing Moria's shadow clone (Doppelman) the entire time. The real Moria has escaped while Luffy wasted precious time before sunrise.
events.significance: Demonstrates Moria's cunning tactical abilities and creates urgency as the shadowless crew members are running out of time before the sun rises and kills them.

quotes.text: You've been chasing my shadow this whole time!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria revealing his deception to Luffy

events.title: Zoro Tests Shusui Against Oars
events.description: Zoro uses his newly acquired sword Shusui to attack Oars, testing its power. He executes a Hyakuhachi Pound Ho technique, which proves significantly more powerful with the legendary black blade. However, Oars dodges the attack with surprising agility.
events.significance: Showcases Shusui's superior strength compared to Zoro's previous swords and establishes Oars' combat capabilities. Zoro notes that Shusui has 'a bit of a temper' and he hasn't fully mastered controlling its weight and power.

quotes.text: This sword has a bit of a temper. I haven't mastered it enough to cut him the way I'd like.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro commenting on Shusui after testing it against Oars

events.title: Risky Brothers Debut
events.description: The Risky Brothers, a pair of zombie squirrels serving under Perona, make their first appearance. They are animated from the shadows of two pirates from Lola's Rolling Pirates crew.
events.significance: Introduces minor zombie characters that add to the variety of Thriller Bark's undead army. Shows the extent of Moria's shadow collection from various pirates.

events.title: Kuma Meets with Moria
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma arrives at Thriller Bark and meets with Gecko Moria. Three zombies witness Moria's shadow returning to his body just as Kuma arrives for their important discussion.
events.significance: Marks Kuma's arrival at Thriller Bark, setting up crucial world-building information about the Seven Warlords and foreshadowing Kuma's later intervention in the arc.

events.title: Blackbeard Becomes a Warlord
events.description: Kuma informs Moria that Marshall D. Teach, known as Blackbeard, has been appointed as Crocodile's replacement among the Seven Warlords of the Sea. Kuma explains that Blackbeard gained the World Government's attention after his encounter with Portgas D. Ace.
events.significance: Major world-building revelation that connects the Thriller Bark arc to larger One Piece storyline. Confirms Blackbeard's rise to power and the consequences of the Banaro Island incident. Establishes the World Government's recognition of Blackbeard's threat level.

quotes.text: The World Government has appointed Crocodile's successor. His name is Marshall D. Teach, otherwise known as Blackbeard.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma informing Moria of Blackbeard's appointment

events.title: Blackbeard vs Ace Flashback
events.description: A flashback shows Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) during his confrontation with Portgas D. Ace. The episode reveals that Blackbeard was formerly part of Whitebeard's crew before betraying them and that he captured Ace, leading to his nomination as a Warlord.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory connecting to the Banaro Island incident and foreshadowing Ace's impending execution and the Marineford War. Shows the consequences of Blackbeard's betrayal of Whitebeard's crew.

events.title: World Government Acknowledges Straw Hats as Threat
events.description: Kuma reveals that the World Government now considers the Straw Hat Pirates a serious threat, particularly after Luffy defeated Rob Lucci at Enies Lobby. This conversation establishes that the crew is no longer viewed as minor pirates but as a significant danger.
events.significance: Validates the Straw Hats' growth and impact on the world. Establishes that their actions at Enies Lobby have had major repercussions for how the World Government views them. Foreshadows increased danger and attention from powerful forces.

events.title: Luffy vs Lucci Flashback Referenced
events.description: During the conversation between Kuma and Moria, there's a brief visual reference to Luffy's battle with Rob Lucci at Enies Lobby, showing the significance of that victory to the World Government's assessment of the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Reinforces the importance of the Enies Lobby arc and shows how that victory elevated the Straw Hats' threat level in the eyes of the World Government.

events.title: Thriller Bark Exits the Florian Triangle
events.description: The Straw Hats realize with horror that Thriller Bark is drifting out of the Florian Triangle's protective fog due to rudder damage Oars caused earlier. This means the shadowless crew members (Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, Robin, and Brook) will be exposed to sunlight and die.
events.significance: Dramatically raises the stakes for the crew. Creates a time limit for defeating Moria and recovering their shadows. The crew must defeat Oars and Moria before sunrise or lose their shadowless members.

events.title: Brook Saves Usopp with Salt
events.description: Brook arrives at a critical moment carrying a large bag of salt and saves Usopp from zombie attackers. The salt purifies the zombies by forcing their shadows to leave their bodies, demonstrating the crew's discovery of an effective anti-zombie weapon.
events.significance: Shows Brook's resourcefulness and the crew's adaptation to the unique threat of Thriller Bark's zombies. Salt becomes a tactical tool for the crew, though it's ineffective against Special Zombies like Oars.

events.title: Moria Enters Oars' Cockpit
events.description: The episode's climactic reveal shows Gecko Moria entering a specially designed cockpit installed inside Oars' stomach. The Straw Hats discover that Moria can now directly control and coordinate with Oars from within, combining Moria's tactical intelligence with Oars' overwhelming physical power.
events.significance: Creates the arc's ultimate threat - the fusion of Moria's strategic mind with Oars' giant strength. This 'most heinous combination of brains and brawn' represents the peak challenge the crew must overcome. Fundamentally changes the nature of the battle.

quotes.text: Now witness the true power of the greatest combination of brains and brawn!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria declaring his strategy from inside Oars' cockpit

events.title: Crew Prepares to Face Moria-Controlled Oars
events.description: The episode concludes with the Straw Hat crew realizing they must now face Oars with Moria controlling him from within. The crew stands together, understanding this will be their greatest challenge yet and they're racing against sunrise.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic battle of the Thriller Bark arc. Establishes the final confrontation parameters and creates tension as the crew must defeat this combined threat before dawn.

quotes.text: You've been chasing my shadow this whole time!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria revealing his deception to Luffy

quotes.text: This sword has a bit of a temper. I haven't mastered it enough to cut him the way I'd like.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro commenting on Shusui after testing it against Oars

quotes.text: The World Government has appointed Crocodile's successor. His name is Marshall D. Teach, otherwise known as Blackbeard.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma informing Moria of Blackbeard's appointment

quotes.text: Now witness the true power of the greatest combination of brains and brawn!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria declaring his strategy from inside Oars' cockpit

themes.description: The episode explores how intelligence and raw strength can be combined for devastating effect, as Moria merges his tactical mind with Oars' overwhelming physical power.
themes.symbolism: The cockpit inside Oars represents the fusion of mind and body, creating a threat greater than the sum of its parts.

themes.description: Multiple elements converge to increase tension: the ship leaving the Florian Triangle, sunrise approaching, and Moria entering Oars' body. The crew faces mounting pressure from all directions.
themes.symbolism: The departing fog symbolizes the loss of protection and the crew's vulnerability to forces beyond their control.

themes.description: The episode demonstrates how past actions create ripple effects across the One Piece world. Luffy's victory over Lucci elevated the crew's threat level, while Blackbeard's betrayal and defeat of Ace reshapes the power balance.
themes.symbolism: The interconnected nature of the pirate world shows that no action exists in isolation.

characterSpotlights.development: Moria demonstrates his cunning by using his shadow to deceive Luffy, then reveals his master plan by entering Oars' cockpit to combine intelligence with overwhelming power.
keyActions: Meets with Kuma to discuss Warlord matters
Enters the cockpit inside Oars' stomach
Prepares to control Oars directly in battle
quotes: You've been chasing my shadow this whole time!
Now witness the true power of the greatest combination of brains and brawn!

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma's arrival provides crucial world-building information and demonstrates his role as a Warlord who stays informed about global events and other pirates.
keyActions: Informs Moria about Blackbeard's appointment as Warlord
Discusses the World Government's view of the Straw Hats as a serious threat
quotes: The World Government has appointed Crocodile's successor. His name is Marshall D. Teach, otherwise known as Blackbeard.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro continues to familiarize himself with Shusui, acknowledging both its superior power and the challenge of mastering it.
keyActions: Uses enhanced Hyakuhachi Pound Ho technique
Comments on the sword's temperament and his need for more practice
quotes: This sword has a bit of a temper. I haven't mastered it enough to cut him the way I'd like.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy falls for Moria's shadow trick, showing that despite his combat prowess, he can still be outmaneuvered tactically. This creates urgency as he's wasted precious time.
keyActions: Pursues what he thinks is Moria
Discovers he was chasing Doppelman (Moria's shadow)
Realizes he's running out of time before sunrise

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scenes of the Straw Hats fighting Oars to show more action before Moria enters the cockpit.
The flashbacks to Blackbeard vs Ace and Luffy vs Lucci were expanded in the anime for better visual storytelling.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 474 of the manga (pages 2-19), titled 'Oars vs. Straw Hat Pirates'.
Both Luffy and Oars are voiced by Mayumi Tanaka in Japanese and Colleen Clinkenbeard in English, with distorted effects for Oars to differentiate them.
The cockpit inside Oars was created when Moria and Hogback restored Oars' corpse, specifically designed to allow Moria to control the giant from within.
This episode aired on September 7, 2008 in Japan but didn't reach US audiences via Toonami until November 19, 2016, over 8 years later.
The title 'Oars Plus Moria - The Greatest Combination of Brains and Brawn' directly references the strategic fusion that occurs when Moria enters the cockpit.
The Risky Brothers zombie squirrels that debut in this episode were created from shadows stolen from members of Lola's Rolling Pirates crew.
